Articles.Content: I just read an interesting article on Ars Technica about whether a rescue mission could have been mounted if the critical damage to Columbia had been recognized before reentry. The article is based primarily on an appendix to the Columbia Accident Investigation Report. Reading it brought to mind the movie Marooned and the dilemma of risking additional personnel to attempt a rescue. Thanks to eight months of KSP, I have a much more intuitive understanding of the constraints imposed by orbital physics.
Sorry about that. I should have looked past the first page of posts.

I wouldn't worry about it.  Given the community here and the subject matter, it's going to get reposted every so often (Especially near the beginning of February).  That other thread was by no means the first.
